text: “You can never be overdressed or overeducated.”
author: Oscar Wilde

text: “A girl should be two things: classy and fabulous.”
author: Coco Chanel

text: “I don't know who invented high heels, but all women owe him a lot!”
author: Marilyn Monroe

text: “Fashion is a form of ugliness so intolerable that we have to alter it every six months.”
author: Oscar Wilde

text: “Dress shabbily and they remember the dress; dress impeccably and they remember the woman.”
author: Coco Chanel

text: “The most beautiful makeup of a woman is passion. But cosmetics are easier to buy.”
author: Yves Saint-Laurent

text: “You're not gay, are you?"
author: Cassandra Clare

text: “Simplicity is the keynote of all true elegance.”
author: Coco Chanel

text: “I love new clothes. If everyone could just wear new clothes everyday, I reckon depression wouldn’t exist anymore.”
author: Sophie Kinsella

text: “Fashion changes, but style endures.”
author: Coco Chanel

text: “The human body is the best work of art.”
author: Jess C. Scott

text: “Bow ties are cool.”
author: Steven Moffat

text: “And now, I'm just trying to change the world, one sequin at a time.”
author: Lady Gaga

text: “A woman who doesn't wear perfume has no future.”
author: Coco Chanel

text: “A fit, healthy body—that is the best fashion statement”
author: Jess C. Scott

text: “Fashion is not something that exists in dresses only. Fashion is in the sky, in the street, fashion has to do with ideas, the way we live, what is happening.”
author: Coco Chanel

text: “True friends are like diamonds – bright, beautiful, valuable, and always in style.”
author: Nicole Richie

text: “I don't do fashion, I AM fashion.”
author: Coco Chanel

text: “Some of the worst mistakes in my life were haircuts”
author: Jim Morrison

text: “Women think of all colors except the absence of color. I have said that black has it all. White too. Their beauty is absolute. It is the perfect harmony.”
author: Coco Chanel

text: “It would be mortifying to the feelings of many ladies, could they be made to understand how little the heart of a man is affected by what is costly or new in their attire... Woman is fine for her own satisfaction alone. No man will admire her the more, no woman will like her the better for it. Neatness and fashion are enough for the former, and a something of shabbiness or impropriety will be most endearing to the latter.”
author: Jane Austen

text: “Style is knowing who you are, what you want to say, and not giving a damn”
author: Orson Welles

text: “I don't believe in fashion. I believe in costume. Life is too short to be same person every day.”
author: Stephanie Perkins

text: “Girls do not dress for boys. They dress for themselves and, of course, each other. If girls dressed for boys they’d just walk around naked at all times.”
author: Betsey Johnson

text: “Elegance is refusal.”
author: Coco Chanel

text: “A girl’s got to use what she’s given and I’m not going to make a guy drool the way a Britney video does. So I take it to extremes. I don’t say I dress sexily on stage - what I do is so extreme. It’s meant to make guys think: ‘I don’t know if this is sexy or just weird.”
author: Lady Gaga

text: “A woman's perfume tells more about her than her handwriting. ”
author: Christian Dior

text: “Adornment, what a science! Beauty, what a weapon! Modesty, what elegance!”
author: Coco Chanel

text: “[Piper] rushed to get dressed. By the time she got up on deck, the others had already gathered—all hastily dressed except for Coach Hedge, who had pulled the night watch.
author: Rick Riordan

text: “I wanted to give a woman comfortable clothes that would flow with her body. A woman is closest to being naked when she is well-dressed.”
author: Coco Chanel
